main event: Several people observed a large, slow-moving object with erratic movements, including vertical and horizontal motions, in the sky near Madison, Tennessee in 1962.
interesting points: The object was initially a magnitude 3 star-like object that lasted 3-4 seconds, followed by two objects of about 1/3 magnitude.
The object had a silhouette-like appearance and seemed to approach the observer, covering 20 degrees in 15 seconds, before an explosion occurred.
The object gave the impression of reflecting light rather than being self-luminous.
The witness did not think the object was an aircraft.
The sighting lasted for about 17 minutes.
sighted object: a large, slow-moving object with erratic movements
